info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN RIO ARRIBA AND SOUTHEASTERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM MDT... At 156 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles north of Chaco Canyon, or 33 miles south of Bloomfield, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Blanco Trading Post, Chaco Canyon, Nageezi and El Huerfano Trading Post. This includes Highway 550 between Mile Markers 114 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Heavy rains will cause water to pond on roads and in low spots. Fast running water will quickly fill arroyos and ditches.
